channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for OK
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for OK

item.title: Report X-2025060785
item.description:
Report X-2025060785

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-09
  • City: TULSA
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: TWO GROUND PACKAGES WERE INSPECTED DUE TO MULTIPE UNMARKED DANGEROUS GOODS PACKAGES DISCOVERED THIS WEEK FROM THIS SHIPPER. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED THREE X TWELVE OUNCE CANS OF ZIPPO LIGHTER FUEL AND FIFTY CUE II LIGHTERS CLASSIFIED AS UN1057, LIGHTERS CONTAINING FLAMMABLE GAS, 2.1. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOXES. ADDITIONAL TRACKING NUMBER TO ANOTHER CONSIGNEE IN THE USA IS 1ZG012Y86858724196.

item.title: Report X-2025060784
item.description:
Report X-2025060784

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-09
  • City: TULSA
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: EIGHTY-SEVEN GROUND PACKAGES WERE STOPPED AND INSPECTED DUE TO MULTIPLE UNDECLARED PACKAGES BEING DISCOVERED THIS WEEK FROM THIS SHIPPER. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED EACH PACKAGE CONTAINS ONE FLAMMABLE UNIVERSAL GAS LIGHTER REFILLS. SOME PACKAGES CONTAIN NEON GAS LIGHTER REFILLS AT 300 ML. OTHER PACKAGES CONTAIN AMERICAN FUEL ZIPPO BUTANE AT 250 ML. THE PACKAGES ARE GOING TO VARIOUS CONSIGNEES IN THE USA. THE PACKAGES WERE DROPPED OFF AT UPS ACCESS POINT LOCATION 7122 S SHERIDAN RD, TULSA OK 74133. THE PACKAGES WERE SHIPPED USING AN INVALID UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER OF G012Y8.

  • Description: FORTY-NINE GROUND PACKAGES WERE STOPPED AND INSPECTED DUE TO PREVIOUS UNDECLARED PACKAGES BEING DISCOVERED FROM THIS SHIPPER. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED EACH PACKAGE CONTAINS ONE FLAMMABLE UNIVERSAL GAS LIGHTER REFILLS. SOME PACKAGES CONTAIN NEON GAS LIGHTER REFILLS AT 300 ML. OTHER PACKGES CONTAIN AMERICAN FUEL ZIPPO BUTANE AT 250 ML. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOXES. PACKAGES ARE GOING TO VARIOUS CONSIGNEES IN THE USA. THE PACKAGES WERE DROPPED OFF AT UPS ACCESS POINT LOCATION 7122 S SHERIDAN RD, TULSA OK 74133. THE PACKAGES WERE SHIPPED USING AN INVALID UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER OF G012Y8.

item.title: Report X-2025060796
item.description:
Report X-2025060796

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-05
  • City: CUSHING
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During sort operations at the MEMH location a fiberboard box was discovered with signs of a release. Inside of the fiberboard box were four metal cans with screw caps in a plastic bag. The cap on one can wasn't sealed causing the release. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report X-2025060533
item.description:
Report X-2025060533

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-02
  • City: TULSA
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDED TO OVER 100 GROUND UNMARKED PACKAGES DUE TO ONE PACKAGE NEEDING TO BE REWRAPPED PROMPTING AN INSPECTION OF ALL PACKAGES. PACKAGE SIZES ARE 8"X8"X3" APPROXIMATELY. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS ALL PACKAGES CONTAIN ONE FLAMMABLE UNIVERSAL GAS LIGHTER REFILLS. SOME PACKAGES CONTAIN NEON GAS LIGHTER REFILLS AT 300 ML AND SOME PACKAGES CONTAIN AMERICAN FUEL ZIPPO BUTANE AT 250 ML. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON ANY OF THE OUTER BOXES. PACKAGES ARE GOING TO VARIOUS CONSIGNEES IN THE USA. THE PACKAGES WERE DROPPED OFF AT UPS ACCESS POINT 7122 S SHERIDAN RD, TULSA OK 74133. THE PACKAGES WERE SHIPPED USING AN INVALID UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER OF G012Y8.

item.description:
Report E-2025060299

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-19
  • City: GLENPOOL
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO ENTERPRISE SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 16:40 ET, XPO-LTU reported approximately 1 cup of Mult-E-Prime 500 High-Build Epoxy Gray (Part A) released from one 5-gallon metal pail to the trailer floor due to a a forklift puncture while loading the trailer. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller who feels comfortable containerizing the released product into one 10-gallon meal drum.
